name: Siwa Oasis
description: Located in Egypt‚Äôs Western Desert, Siwa is known for its salt lakes, hot springs, palm groves.

overview.description: Siwa Oasis is one of Egypt‚Äôs most remote and enchanting destinations, located near the Libyan border in the heart of the Western Desert. Known for its serene landscapes, Siwa offers a unique blend of natural beauty, Natural significance, and indigenous Amazigh (Berber) culture.The oasis is home to crystal-clear salt lakes, hot and cold springs, golden sand dunes, and thousands of date palm trees. One of its most famous spots is Cleopatra‚Äôs Pool, a natural spring where legend says the queen herself once bathed..
overview.address: Siwa Oasis, Matrouh Governorate, Western Desert, Egypt

detail.howToGet: From Cairo:üöó By Car: 750 km (about 10 hours)üöå By Bus:  (12‚Äì14 hours)
detail.tips: Go early to avoid queues

activity.name: Sandboarding
activity.description: Experience the thrill of sliding down the golden dunes of Siwa.

activity.name: Hot Spring Bath
activity.description: Relax in the natural hot springs surrounded by serene landscapes.

activity.name: Visit Cleopatra‚Äôs Pool
activity.description: Swim in the legendary spring where Cleopatra is said to have bathed.

review1.name: Sarah A.
review1.content: Siwa is magical ‚Äî stunning salt lakes, friendly locals, and a deep connection to nature.

review2.name: Ahmed M.
review2.content: stunning salt lakes, friendly locals, and a deep connection to nature.

name: White Desert
description: A protected area in Farafra featuring stunning white rock formations. A surreal landscape perfect for camping and stargazing.

overview.description: The White Desert is a breathtaking natural wonder in Egypt‚Äôs Western Desert. Known for its surreal chalk formations created by wind erosion, the landscape resembles a snowy Arctic scene. It's a favorite destination for adventurers, campers, and photographers. The contrast of the white rocks against the golden sands creates a truly magical experience.
overview.address: White Desert National Park, Farafra, New Valley Governorate, Egypt

detail.bestTimeToVisit: October to April (cooler months, ideal for camping)
detail.howToGet: From Cairo: üöó By Car: around 570 km (8 hours) üöå By Bus: via Bawiti or Farafra
detail.tips: Bring warm clothes for night camping and extra water.

activity.name: Camping Night
activity.description: Spend the night under the stars in a tent and enjoy the magical desert silence.

activity.name: Photography Tour
activity.description: Capture the surreal white rock formations with a guided photography session.

activity.name: Desert Trekking
activity.description: Explore the unique chalk formations on a guided trek across the desert.

review1.name: Laila F.
review1.content: Camping under the stars in the White Desert is unforgettable. The silence, the sky, everything is surreal.

review2.name: Omar N.
review2.content: I felt like I was on another planet. The landscapes are out of this world.

name: Ras Mohammed National Park
description: Located in South Sinai, this marine protected area is one of the top diving spots in the world with vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life.

overview.description: Ras Mohammed National Park is Egypt‚Äôs first national park, established in 1983. It lies at the southern tip of the Sinai Peninsula, where the Gulf of Suez meets the Gulf of Aqaba. Known for its crystal-clear waters, coral reefs, and unique mangroves, it‚Äôs a haven for snorkelers, divers, and nature lovers. The park also offers dramatic desert landscapes and salt lakes.
overview.address: Ras Mohammed National Park, South Sinai Governorate, Egypt

detail.entryFees: EGP 25 for Egyptians, EGP 140 for foreigners
detail.bestTimeToVisit: March to June and September to November (ideal for diving and snorkeling)
detail.howToGet: From Sharm El Sheikh: üöó By Car: about 30 km (30‚Äì40 minutes)
detail.tips: Bring snorkeling gear, sunscreen, and enough drinking water. Respect marine life and park regulations.

activity.name: Snorkeling
activity.description: Explore vibrant coral reefs and swim alongside colorful fish in crystal-clear waters.

activity.name: Scuba Diving
activity.description: Dive into the Red Sea to discover amazing marine life and underwater landscapes.

activity.name: Boat Tour
activity.description: Enjoy a scenic boat tour around the park‚Äôs coastline, witnessing mangroves and salt lakes.

review1.name: Mona S.
review1.content: The water was so clear and full of colorful fish! One of the best snorkeling experiences I‚Äôve ever had.

review2.name: Youssef H.
review2.content: Absolutely stunning natural beauty ‚Äì both underwater and on land. Highly recommended!

name: Blue Hole
description: A world-famous diving site on the Red Sea, ideal for experienced divers and underwater photography lovers.

overview.description: The Blue Hole, located near Dahab in South Sinai, is one of the most famous dive sites in the world. This underwater sinkhole is renowned for its deep blue color and rich marine life. With depths reaching over 100 meters, it's a favorite among experienced divers and underwater photographers.
overview.address: Blue Hole, Dahab, South Sinai Governorate, Egypt

detail.entryFees: Free, but diving tours may charge separately
detail.bestTimeToVisit: March to June and September to November
detail.howToGet: From Dahab: üöï Taxi: 15-minute drive üèçÔ∏è Scooter rental is also common
detail.tips: Only experienced divers should attempt deep dives. Don‚Äôt forget reef-safe sunscreen and snorkeling gear.

activity.name: Scuba Diving
activity.description: Dive into the Blue Hole‚Äôs depths to explore vibrant corals and rich marine life. Suitable for experienced divers.

activity.name: Snorkeling
activity.description: Explore the upper layers of the Blue Hole, observing colorful fish and corals safely.

activity.name: Underwater Photography
activity.description: Capture stunning shots of the Blue Hole‚Äôs marine life and deep blue waters.

review1.name: Yasmin A.
review1.content: Absolutely mesmerizing! The corals and marine life were stunning. One of my favorite dive spots ever.

review2.name: Mohamed T.
review2.content: Very deep and beautiful site, but definitely not for beginners. The view from the surface is incredible too!

name: Wadi El Rayan
description: A natural reserve with Egypt‚Äôs only waterfalls, large lakes, and surrounding sand dunes great for swimming and sandboarding.

overview.description: Wadi El Rayan is a protected area in Fayoum, Egypt, known for its stunning waterfalls, vast desert, and tranquil lakes. It‚Äôs a perfect getaway for nature lovers, families, and adventure seekers. The area is rich with biodiversity and offers a unique desert-lake landscape found nowhere else in Egypt.
overview.address: Wadi El Rayan Reserve, Fayoum Governorate, Egypt

detail.entryFees: EGP 10 for Egyptians, EGP 50 for foreigners
detail.bestTimeToVisit: October to April (pleasant weather, best for sandboarding and photography)
detail.howToGet: From Cairo: üöó By Car: ~150 km (around 2 hours) üöå By Microbus from El-Moneeb station
detail.tips: Don‚Äôt forget sunscreen, extra water, and a camera for the waterfalls. Avoid weekends for a quieter visit.

activity.name: Waterfalls Visit
activity.description: Explore Egypt‚Äôs only natural waterfalls and enjoy the refreshing water. Perfect for family outings and photography.

activity.name: Sandboarding
activity.description: Slide down the desert dunes surrounding Wadi El Rayan for an adrenaline-packed adventure.

activity.name: Swimming in Lakes
activity.description: Relax and swim in the reserve‚Äôs tranquil lakes, surrounded by beautiful natural scenery.

review1.name: Nour H.
review1.content: The waterfalls are breathtaking and the desert drive was thrilling!

review2.name: Kareem M.
review2.content: Very peaceful place, just avoid weekends if you want to skip the crowds.

description: A remote mountain range in southeastern Egypt, rich in biodiversity and home to rare wildlife.

overview.description: A remote and ecologically unique mountain range located in southeastern Egypt, known for its lush vegetation, rare wildlife, and limited access.

detail.howToGet: By 4x4 vehicles through guided eco-tours
detail.tips: Get proper permissions, carry enough supplies, and be prepared for no cellular signal.

description: A tranquil, clear-water beach in Dahab ideal for relaxing, kite surfing, and snorkeling.

overview.description: A tranquil, clear-water beach in Dahab ideal for relaxing, kite surfing, and snorkeling.

name: Bahariya Oasis
description: A lush oasis in the desert surrounded by black desert hills and ancient tombs.

overview.description: Bahariya Oasis is a serene desert retreat known for its palm groves, natural springs, and proximity to the Black and White Deserts.

detail.howToGet: By 4x4 vehicle or organized tour from Cairo
detail.tips: Bring sunscreen and plenty of water. Ideal for desert camping and stargazing.

name: St. Catherine‚Äôs Monastery
description: One of the oldest working Christian monasteries, located at the foot of Mount Sinai.

overview.description: Located at the foot of Mount Sinai, St. Catherine‚Äôs Monastery is one of the oldest Christian monasteries still in use. It houses ancient manuscripts, religious icons, and is considered a UNESCO World Heritage site.

detail.howToGet: By car or tour from Sharm El-Sheikh or Dahab
detail.tips: Dress modestly, and respect religious customs. Photography might be restricted in some areas.

activity.name: Monastery Tour
activity.description: Guided tour inside the monastery to explore its ancient library, icons, and chapels.

activity.name: Icon Gallery Visit
activity.description: View one of the world's most important collections of early Christian icons.

activity.name: Mount Sinai Sunrise Hike
activity.description: Climb Mount Sinai early in the morning to witness a breathtaking sunrise.

review1.name: Mona S.
review1.content: The water was so clear and full of colorful fish! One of the best snorkeling experiences I‚Äôve ever had.

name: Pyramids of Giza
description: Iconic ancient monuments including the Great Pyramid and the Sphinx, located on the Giza

overview.description: The Giza Plateau features three legendary pyramids: The Great Pyramid of Khufu, the largest and only surviving Wonder of the Ancient World;  the Pyramid of Khafre, known for its elevated base and proximity to the Great Sphinx; and the Pyramid of Menkaure, the smallest yet refined in design.Together, they reflect the engineering mastery and spiritual depth of ancient Egypt.

detail.entryFees: EGP 200 for Egyptians, EGP 400 for foreigners
detail.bestTimeToVisit: October to April (cooler weather and fewer crowds)
detail.howToGet: Take the metro to Giza Station, then use a taxi or Careem
detail.tips: Go early

activity.name: Camel Ride
activity.description: Experience a traditional camel ride around the pyramids with panoramic desert views.

activity.name: Guided Pyramid Tour
activity.description: Learn about the history and construction of the pyramids with a professional Egyptologist.

activity.name: Sound and Light Show
activity.description: Watch the pyramids illuminated at night with a narrated light show.

review1.name: Sarah A.
review1.content: Great for families. Kids loved it. Camel ride was fun but overpriced

review2.name: Ahmed M.
review2.content: Absolutely breathtaking! A must-see. Go early to avoid crowds

name: Karnak Temple
description: A vast temple complex in Luxor built over 2,000 years, dedicated to the Theban gods.

overview.description: Karnak Temple is one of the largest religious buildings ever constructed, covering over 100 hectares. Located in Luxor, it features a vast mix of decayed temples, chapels, pylons, and other buildings. It was primarily dedicated to the Theban triad of Amun, Mut, and Khonsu.

detail.entryFees: EGP 150 for Egyptians, EGP 300 for foreigners
detail.howToGet: Fly to Luxor or take a train from Cairo, then use local transport to the temple.
detail.tips: Visit early in the morning to avoid heat and crowds. Wear comfortable shoes.

activities.name: Guided Tour
activities.description: Explore the temple with a professional guide and learn the history and architecture.

activities.name: Photography Session
activities.description: Capture the grandeur of Karnak Temple at sunrise or sunset.

activities.name: Cultural Workshop
activities.description: Participate in a workshop on ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs and religious rituals.

review1.name: Mona H.
review1.content: A place full of history. The Hypostyle Hall is simply stunning!

review2.name: Omar K.
review2.content: Huge and impressive. Great guide helped bring the place to life.

name: Valley of the Kings
description: The burial site of ancient pharaohs, including Tutankhamun, hidden in the Theban hills of Luxor.

overview.description: The Valley of the Kings is a royal burial ground for pharaohs and powerful nobles of the New Kingdom. It includes over 60 tombs, most famously that of Tutankhamun. The tombs are carved deep into the desert rock, decorated with scenes from Egyptian mythology.
overview.address: Luxor West Bank, Luxor Governorate, Egypt

detail.entryFees: EGP 160 for Egyptians, EGP 240 for foreigners (general ticket)
detail.howToGet: Accessible by car, minibus, or tour groups from Luxor. Located on the west bank of the Nile.
detail.tips: Bring water, wear a hat, and consider hiring a guide for detailed insights into each tomb.

activity.name: Guided Tomb Tours
activity.description: Explore the intricate tombs with an Egyptologist who explains the history and meaning of the wall paintings.

activity.name: Luxor West Bank Day Trip
activity.description: Combine your visit with other sites such as Hatshepsut Temple and the Colossi of Memnon.

activity.name: Nile Felucca Ride at Sunset
activity.description: Relax on a traditional felucca boat ride along the Nile after exploring the Valley.

review1.name: Layla R.
review1.content: The tombs were incredible to see. Photography isn‚Äôt allowed inside, but the memories stay.

review2.name: Tamer F.
review2.content: Deeply impressive. Some tombs are closed, but those open are amazing!

name: Citadel of Saladin
description: A medieval Islamic fort with panoramic views of Cairo and the iconic Mosque

overview.description: The Citadel of Saladin is a historic Islamic fortification in Cairo. Built in the 12th century by Salah al-Din, it served as Egypt's seat of government for over 700 years. The Citadel offers panoramic views of Cairo and houses several mosques and museums, including the famous Mosque of Muhammad Ali.
overview.address: Al Abageyah, El Khalifa, Cairo Governorate, Egypt

detail.entryFees: EGP 60 for Egyptians, EGP 180 for foreigners
detail.howToGet: Easily accessible by taxi, Uber, or local transportation from central Cairo.
detail.tips: Wear comfortable shoes, bring a camera for panoramic shots, and visit early to avoid crowds.

activity.name: Mosque of Muhammad Ali Tour
activity.description: Explore the grand Ottoman-style mosque inside the Citadel, known for its stunning domes and intricate decorations.

activity.name: Military Museum Visit
activity.description: Discover Egypt's military history through uniforms, weapons, and artifacts from various eras.

activity.name: Panoramic Photography Session
activity.description: Capture the breathtaking skyline of Cairo from the Citadel‚Äôs elevated viewpoints.

review1.name: Yasmine A.
review1.content: The view of Cairo from the top was breathtaking. The mosque inside is beautiful.

review2.name: Karim H.
review2.content: Rich in history and very well preserved. A must-see for any visitor to Cairo.

name: Philae Temple
description: A picturesque temple on an island in Aswan, dedicated to the goddess Isis.

overview.description: Philae Temple is one of Egypt‚Äôs most beautiful temples, located on Agilkia Island in Aswan. It was moved from its original location to avoid flooding after the construction of the High Dam. The temple is dedicated to the goddess Isis and is known for its stunning reliefs and sound-and-light show.

detail.entryFees: EGP 40 for Egyptians, EGP 140 for foreigners
detail.bestTimeToVisit: October to April (cool and pleasant weather)
detail.howToGet: Reachable by boat from the Marina Philae Temple in Aswan.
detail.tips: Visit early in the morning to avoid heat, and consider staying for the evening sound-and-light show.

activity.name: Boat Ride to Agilkia Island
activity.description: Enjoy a scenic boat trip on the Nile to reach the temple while admiring the surrounding islands.

activity.name: Sound and Light Show
activity.description: Experience the magical night-time illumination of the temple with stories of ancient Egypt narrated dramatically.
activity.price: EGP 100 for Egyptians, EGP 250 for foreigners

activity.name: Photography Tour
activity.description: Capture the temple‚Äôs intricate carvings, columns, and island setting with perfect lighting conditions.

review1.name: Noura M.
review1.content: Absolutely breathtaking location and history. The boat ride made the experience special.

review2.name: Ahmed T.
review2.content: A magical place full of myths and beauty. Must visit when in Aswan.

name: Egyptian Museum
description: Home to thousands of ancient artifacts including the treasures of King Tutankhamun.

overview.description: Located in Tahrir Square, Cairo, the Egyptian Museum houses an extensive collection of ancient Egyptian antiquities. Among the most famous exhibits are the golden mask and treasures of King Tutankhamun, mummies of pharaohs, and countless statues and relics spanning thousands of years.

detail.entryFees: EGP 30 for Egyptians, EGP 200 for foreigners
detail.bestTimeToVisit: Weekdays in the morning to avoid crowds
detail.howToGet: Easily reachable via Cairo Metro (Sadat Station) or taxi to Tahrir Square.
detail.tips: Allow at least 2 hours for your visit; guided tours enhance the experience.

activity.name: Tutankhamun‚Äôs Treasures Tour
activity.description: Explore the golden mask, jewelry, and artifacts from the tomb of King Tutankhamun.

activity.name: Mummy Room Visit
activity.description: See the preserved mummies of ancient pharaohs up close for a fascinating look at history.
activity.price: EGP 150 for foreigners, EGP 30 for Egyptians

activity.name: Guided Museum Tour
activity.description: Join an expert Egyptologist for a deeper understanding of the museum‚Äôs highlights.

review1.name: Hana K.
review1.content: Incredible collection! Seeing Tutankhamun‚Äôs mask in person is unforgettable.

review2.name: Omar Z.
review2.content: So much to see, it's overwhelming! Wish there were more labels in English.

name: Abu Simbel Temples
description: Massive rock temples of Ramses II relocated to save them from flooding.

overview.description: Located in southern Egypt near the Sudanese border, Abu Simbel Temples are two massive rock temples built by Pharaoh Ramses II. They were relocated in a historic UNESCO operation to avoid submersion due to the Aswan High Dam. The temples are dedicated to Ramses II and his queen Nefertari, and aligned to allow sunlight to illuminate the inner sanctuary twice a year.

detail.entryFees: EGP 40 for Egyptians, EGP 255 for foreigners
detail.bestTimeToVisit: February and October during the Sun Festival
detail.howToGet: Accessible by road (approx. 3.5 hours from Aswan) or via domestic flight to Abu Simbel Airport.
detail.tips: Visit during sunrise for the best lighting and fewer crowds; wear sun protection.

activity.name: Sun Festival Experience
activity.description: Witness the incredible alignment where the sun illuminates the inner sanctuary twice a year (February & October).

activity.name: Guided History Tour
activity.description: Learn the fascinating story of the temples' construction and relocation from an expert guide.

activity.name: Photography Session at Sunrise
activity.description: Capture breathtaking shots of the temples with the golden morning light.

review1.name: Sarah M.
review1.content: A breathtaking site with incredible history. The scale of the temples is amazing.

review2.name: Ali F.
review2.content: Long trip but totally worth it! Highly recommend catching the Sun Festival if you can.

name: Al-Muizz Street
description: A historic area full of mosques, markets, and medieval architecture reflecting Islamic Cairo‚Äôs rich heritage.

overview.description: Al-Muizz Street is one of the oldest streets in Cairo and is often called an open-air museum. It's lined with stunning examples of Islamic architecture, including mosques, madrasas, and sabils. The street comes alive with local markets, traditional crafts, and vibrant cultural life.

detail.entryFees: Free access; some monuments may charge small fees
detail.bestTimeToVisit: Late afternoon or evening for cooler weather and ambiance
detail.howToGet: Located in central Cairo; accessible via metro (Al-Azhar station) or taxi.
detail.tips: Wear comfortable shoes; visit early to avoid crowds and enjoy photography opportunities.

activity.name: Historical Walking Tour
activity.description: Explore centuries-old mosques, madrasas, and sabils with a knowledgeable guide who brings history to life.

activity.name: Souvenir Shopping
activity.description: Browse traditional markets for handmade crafts, lanterns, spices, and antiques.

activity.name: Night Photography Walk
activity.description: Capture the magical glow of historic buildings lit up at night along Al-Muizz Street.

review1.name: Mona E.
review1.content: Walking through Al-Muizz feels like a journey back in time. The buildings are full of character.

review2.name: Youssef K.
review2.content: Perfect for history and culture lovers. Lots of beautiful spots to take photos.

name: Abu Serga
description: One of the oldest Coptic churches, believed to be visited by the Holy Family during their stay in Egypt.

overview.description: Abu Serga Church, also known as Saints Sergius and Bacchus Church, is located in Old Cairo and is considered one of the oldest Coptic churches in Egypt. It holds great religious significance as it is believed to have sheltered the Holy Family during their flight into Egypt. The church features beautiful wooden ceilings, ancient icons, and a crypt where the Holy Family stayed.
overview.address: Mar Girgis Street, Old Cairo, Cairo Governorate, Egypt

detail.howToGet: Take the Cairo Metro to Mar Girgis Station; the church is a short walk from the station.
detail.tips: Dress modestly; photography may be restricted in some areas.

activity.name: Historical & Religious Tour
activity.description: Join a guided tour to learn about the church‚Äôs history, Coptic traditions, and its role in the Holy Family‚Äôs journey.

activity.name: Old Cairo Heritage Walk
activity.description: Explore the surrounding area including the Hanging Church, Ben Ezra Synagogue, and Coptic Museum.

activity.name: Religious Icon Viewing
activity.description: Admire centuries-old Coptic icons and wooden craftsmanship preserved within the church.

review1.name: Nermine S.
review1.content: A deeply spiritual place. The atmosphere is peaceful and full of history. Highly recommend a visit.

review2.name: Peter A.
review2.content: The crypt is a must-see. It's humbling to stand in a place believed to have sheltered the Holy Family.

name: Al-Azhar Mosque
description: Al-Azhar Mosque is a historic Islamic landmark in Cairo and one of the oldest centers of Islamic learning in the world.

overview.description: Founded in 970 AD, Al-Azhar Mosque is not only one of the most iconic mosques in Cairo but also a prominent university and one of the world's oldest centers for Islamic education. The mosque's architecture showcases a blend of Fatimid, Mamluk, and Ottoman styles. It remains a spiritual and intellectual hub for Muslims around the globe.

detail.howToGet: Located near Al-Azhar Street; easily accessible by taxi or by walking from El-Hussein area.
detail.tips: Dress modestly, women may need to cover their heads, and respect prayer times.

activity.name: Guided Historical Tour
activity.description: Discover the mosque‚Äôs 1,000-year history, architecture, and role in Islamic education with a knowledgeable guide.

activity.name: Islamic Architecture Photography
activity.description: Capture the intricate Fatimid, Mamluk, and Ottoman details in the mosque‚Äôs minarets and courtyards.

activity.name: Old Cairo Cultural Walk
activity.description: Combine your visit with nearby attractions like Khan El Khalili, El-Hussein Mosque, and Al-Muizz Street.

review1.name: Ahmed Z.
review1.content: The mosque is breathtaking! Rich in history and still active with students and worshippers. A must-visit in Cairo.

review2.name: Fatima R.
review2.content: Al-Azhar is more than a mosque ‚Äî it's a symbol of knowledge and heritage. The courtyards are stunning.

name: Hatshepsut Temple
description: A mortuary temple built for the powerful Queen Hatshepsut, located beneath the cliffs at Deir el-Bahari.

overview.description: The Temple of Hatshepsut, also known as Djeser-Djeseru, is a stunning mortuary temple built for the female pharaoh Hatshepsut. It is nestled at the base of the towering cliffs of Deir el-Bahari near the Valley of the Kings. The temple is famous for its unique architecture, terraces, and colonnades that blend beautifully into the surrounding desert landscape.

detail.entryFees: 160 EGP for adults, 80 EGP for students
detail.bestTimeToVisit: Early morning to avoid the heat
detail.howToGet: Located in Luxor's West Bank, can be reached via taxi, bus, or organized tours.
detail.tips: Wear comfortable shoes, bring water, and try to arrive early to avoid crowds.

activity.name: Guided Historical Tour
activity.description: Learn about Queen Hatshepsut‚Äôs reign, the temple‚Äôs architecture, and its religious significance from an expert Egyptologist.

activity.name: Photography from the Cliffs
activity.description: Hike up nearby cliffs for panoramic views of the temple against the desert backdrop.

activity.name: West Bank Day Tour
activity.description: Combine your visit with nearby attractions like the Valley of the Kings, Medinet Habu, and Colossi of Memnon.

review1.name: Lena M.
review1.content: Incredible architecture and fascinating history. The temple feels surreal, especially in the morning light.

review2.name: Youssef T.
review2.content: One of the highlights of my visit to Luxor! You can really feel the grandeur of ancient Egypt here.

name: Saqqara Step Pyramid
description: The oldest known pyramid in Egypt, built for Pharaoh Djoser in the 27th century BC.

overview.description: The Saqqara Step Pyramid, also known as the Pyramid of Djoser, is considered the earliest colossal stone structure in Egypt. Built during the 27th century BC, it marks a major advancement in ancient Egyptian architecture. It consists of six mastaba-like layers stacked on top of each other and is located in the vast necropolis of Saqqara.
overview.address: Saqqara Necropolis, south of Cairo, Egypt

detail.entryFees: 180 EGP for adults, 90 EGP for students
detail.bestTimeToVisit: Morning hours, especially in cooler months
detail.howToGet: Located around 30 km south of Cairo; accessible by taxi or guided tours.
detail.tips: Carry water and sun protection; consider combining with nearby tomb visits.

activity.name: Guided Pyramid Tour
activity.description: Explore the history and architecture of the Step Pyramid with an Egyptologist guide.

activity.name: Visit the Serapeum of Saqqara
activity.description: Discover the underground burial site of the sacred Apis bulls, located nearby.

activity.name: Camel Ride Around the Necropolis
activity.description: Enjoy a camel ride for a unique view of the Step Pyramid and surrounding desert landscape.

review1.name: Daniel K.
review1.content: A must-see if you're interested in ancient history. The site is less crowded and gives a raw, authentic feel.

review2.name: Salma H.
review2.content: The oldest pyramid in Egypt is impressive and full of hidden history. Highly recommend a guide.

name: SOHO Square
description: SOHO Square is a shopping and entertainment complex that‚Äôs great for all ages. Check out the dancing fountain, take a whirl on the ball pit and slides at the Kids‚Äô Zone, and snag a souvenir at the souk-themed Khan El-Khalili Bazaar.

overview.description: SOHO Square is a shopping and entertainment complex that‚Äôs great for all ages. Check out the dancing fountain, take a whirl on the ball pit and slides at the Kids‚Äô Zone, and snag a souvenir at the souk-themed Khan El-Khalili Bazaar. For a great group activity, you can even go bowling and ice skating, or have a game of billiards and tennis. Dining-wise, take your pick from a range of casual eateries, fast food joints, and fine dining establishments while enjoying our 10 different cuisines.

detail.entryFees: Free entry to the square; some attractions may have additional charges
detail.howToGet: Easily reachable by taxi or local bus; within walking distance from nearby hotels in the Sharks Bay area
detail.tips: Visit in the evening to enjoy the colorful fountain show and make the most of family-friendly activities

activity.name: Dancing Fountain Show
activity.description: A stunning fountain display synchronized with music and colorful lights ‚Äì one of the main highlights of the square.

activity.name: Culturama Panoramic Experience
activity.description: A panoramic cinema offering an interactive cultural presentation spanning 4,500 years of Egypt's history.

activity.name: Ice Rink & Bowling
activity.description: Enjoy ice-skating and bowling with family and friends, plus other sports like tennis and squash.

review1.name: David R.
review1.content: SOHO Square is great for all ages. The evening atmosphere is magical with the fountain and lights. Plenty of dining options at reasonable prices.

review2.name: Mohamed Agha
review2.content: Modern and clean design, with beautiful colored lights and great night music. The Asian restaurant was a personal favorite with amazing views.

name: Ras Mohammed National Park
description: Ras Mohammed National Park is Egypt‚Äôs premier marine reserve, famous for its vibrant coral reefs, mangroves, and unique desert-mountain scenery.

overview.description: Located at the southern tip of the Sinai Peninsula, Ras Mohammed National Park is a UNESCO-listed site offering world-class diving and snorkeling experiences. Visitors can explore over 200 species of coral and a stunning variety of marine life. The park also features mangrove forests, desert hiking trails, and panoramic views from Shark Observatory.
overview.address: Ras Mohammed, South Sinai Governorate, Egypt

detail.entryFees: EGP 150 for foreigners, EGP 10 for Egyptians (may vary)
detail.bestTimeToVisit: July to October for best visibility
detail.howToGet: Book a guided tour or take a taxi from Sharm El Sheikh (approx. 30-40 mins)
detail.tips: Bring snorkeling gear, sunscreen, and water. Wear reef-safe sunscreen to protect corals.

activity.name: Snorkeling Adventure
activity.description: Discover stunning coral reefs and tropical fish in crystal-clear waters.

activity.name: Scuba Diving Experience
activity.description: Dive with a certified guide to explore Ras Mohammed‚Äôs most famous underwater spots.

activity.name: Shark Observatory Viewpoint
activity.description: Enjoy breathtaking panoramic views of the Red Sea and Gulf of Suez from the park‚Äôs highest point.

review1.name: James K.
review1.content: Absolutely stunning underwater scenery. The visibility was perfect and the marine life was abundant.

review2.name: Sara M.
review2.content: Beautiful park with amazing coral reefs. A must-visit for nature lovers.

name: Naama Bay
description: Naama Bay is the vibrant hub of Sharm El Sheikh‚Äîfamous for its long sandy beaches, lively nightlife, restaurants, caf√©s, and shopping.

overview.description: Situated along the Red Sea coast, Naama Bay is the city‚Äôs main tourist hotspot, offering sunbathing on sandy beaches, water sports, caf√©s, restaurants, bars, and local bazaars in a vibrant, atmospheric setting :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.
overview.address: Naama Bay, Sharm El Sheikh, South Sinai, Egypt

detail.entryFees: Free beach access, some venues may charge
detail.bestTimeToVisit: Evenings for nightlife and promenade strolls
detail.howToGet: Within walking distance from many hotels; taxis readily available
detail.tips: Stroll after sunset to enjoy shops, caf√©s, and street performances.

activity.name: Beach & Water Sports
activity.description: Enjoy sunbathing, snorkeling, diving, or water-skiing in the clear waters of the bay.

activity.name: Evening Promenade & Dining
activity.description: Walk along the lively waterfront lined with restaurants, caf√©s, and bars.

activity.name: Shopping & Street Vibes
activity.description: Explore local crafts, souvenirs, and enjoy the buzzing ambiance.

review1.name: Emily R.
review1.content: Naama Bay is vibrant and fun with something for everyone‚Äîperfect mix of beach and nightlife.

review2.name: Omar S.
review2.content: Fantastic atmosphere at night with plenty of dining and shopping options, though some venues can be pricey.

name: Old Market (Sharm El Sheikh)
description: The Old Market is a bustling traditional souq in Sharm, filled with spices, crafts, textiles, and local street food.

overview.description: With winding alleys and eclectic shops, the Old Market blends authentic Egyptian charm with tourist appeal‚Äîselling spices, textiles, souvenirs, and local crafts in a lively, scented atmosphere :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.
overview.address: El-Souk, Sharm El Sheikh, South Sinai, Egypt

detail.visitingHours: Daily from 09:00 AM ‚Äì 10:00 PM (some sources say open 24h) :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
detail.entryFees: Free entry; prices on goods vary
detail.bestTimeToVisit: Evening hours for cooler temperature and lively atmosphere :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
detail.howToGet: Center of city‚Äîeasy walking or taxi from Naama Bay area
detail.tips: Bring cash (EGP), bargain politely, and sample authentic street food.

activity.name: Shopping Souvenirs & Spices
activity.description: Browse handcrafted jewelry, textiles, spices and traditional goods.

activity.name: Street Food Sampling
activity.description: Try local delicacies like kebabs, falafel, and Egyptian sweets.

activity.name: Cultural Stroll
activity.description: Experience the vibrant energy, aromas, and weaving alleys of the marketplace.

review1.name: Nadia F.
review1.content: Vibrant and colorful‚Äîbest place to pick up spices and crafts. Loved bargaining with the shopkeepers.

review2.name: Ahmed L.
review2.content: Authentic Egyptian vibe and great street food stalls. Go in the evening for a cooler, lively experience.

name: Crystal Mountain
description: A natural rock formation glittering with quartz crystals, located between the Bahariya and Farafra oases.

overview.description: Crystal Mountain is a small hill made of quartz crystals, formed naturally over millions of years. It‚Äôs a popular stop on the way to the White Desert, where sunlight makes the crystals sparkle brilliantly.

detail.bestTimeToVisit: Morning or late afternoon for the best light
detail.howToGet: Accessible by 4x4 on the road between Bahariya and Farafra oases.
detail.tips: Avoid removing crystals, as it‚Äôs protected. Best visited with a local guide.

activity.name: Photo Stop
activity.description: Take stunning photographs of the sparkling quartz formations.

activity.name: Geology Exploration
activity.description: Learn about the geological history of the crystal formations with a guide.

review1.name: Omar K.
review1.content: Beautiful stop on the way to the White Desert. The crystals shine in the sun!

review2.name: Hannah W.
review2.content: A quick but magical visit. Don‚Äôt expect to spend hours, but worth stopping.

name: Al Qasr Village
description: An ancient Islamic village in Dakhla Oasis with mudbrick houses, narrow alleys, and historic mosques.

overview.description: Al Qasr is a well-preserved medieval village that served as the capital of Dakhla Oasis in the Islamic period. Visitors can explore narrow streets, traditional houses, and ancient mosques built of mudbrick.
overview.address: Al Qasr Village, Dakhla Oasis, New Valley, Egypt

detail.entryFees: EGP 20 for Egyptians, EGP 60 for foreigners
detail.howToGet: Reachable via road from Mut in Dakhla Oasis. Best visited with a guide.
detail.tips: Wear comfortable shoes and carry water.

activity.name: Walking Tour
activity.description: Explore the maze-like alleys and historic sites of the village.

activity.name: Cultural Photography
activity.description: Capture the beauty of mudbrick architecture and Islamic heritage.

review1.name: Fatma E.
review1.content: A true step back in time. Very peaceful and full of history.

review2.name: John P.
review2.content: Fascinating to walk through such a well-preserved ancient village.

name: Great Sand Sea
description: A vast expanse of golden sand dunes stretching between Egypt and Libya.

overview.description: The Great Sand Sea is one of the largest sand dune fields in the world, covering about 72,000 km¬≤. Visitors can enjoy sandboarding, 4x4 adventures, and incredible sunset views.
overview.address: Great Sand Sea, Western Desert, Egypt

detail.howToGet: Accessible via guided desert safari from Siwa or Bahariya Oasis.
detail.tips: Bring sunglasses, water, and sunscreen. Sandboarding is a must-try.

activity.name: Sandboarding
activity.description: Ride down the giant dunes on a sandboard for an adrenaline rush.

activity.name: 4x4 Safari
activity.description: Experience the thrill of driving across massive dunes in a 4x4 vehicle.

review1.name: Salma R.
review1.content: Unforgettable! The dunes are breathtaking and sandboarding was so much fun.

review2.name: David L.
review2.content: The desert feels endless. Perfect spot for adventurous travelers.

name: Abu Galum Protectorate
description: A protected area with crystal-clear waters, coral reefs, and scenic desert mountains.

overview.description: Abu Galum Protectorate is a stunning blend of mountains, desert, and sea. Known for its biodiversity and pristine coral reefs, it‚Äôs a perfect escape for eco-tourism, snorkeling, and camel rides along the coast.
overview.address: Abu Galum Protectorate, Dahab, South Sinai, Egypt

detail.howToGet: Boat or camel ride from Blue Hole area.
detail.tips: Bring snorkeling gear and plenty of water.

activity.name: Camel Ride by the Sea
activity.description: Travel along the scenic coastline to Abu Galum on a traditional camel.

activity.name: Snorkeling Adventure
activity.description: Explore the untouched coral reefs and vibrant marine life.

review1.name: Nour H.
review1.content: The most peaceful place I‚Äôve been to in Sinai.

review2.name: Mark D.
review2.content: Incredible reefs, highly recommend the camel ride.

name: Wadi Gnai
description: A popular spot for rock climbing, hiking, and exploring desert canyons.

overview.description: Wadi Gnai is a desert valley located just outside Dahab, famous for its rugged cliffs, hiking trails, and rock climbing routes. It‚Äôs a great spot for adventure seekers looking to combine sport and nature.
overview.address: Wadi Gnai, Dahab, South Sinai, Egypt

detail.howToGet: 15 minutes by car or bike from Dahab center.
detail.tips: Wear proper shoes and bring climbing gear if you plan to climb.

activity.name: Rock Climbing
activity.description: Test your skills on various climbing routes with different difficulty levels.

activity.name: Hiking
activity.description: Enjoy scenic desert views and explore hidden canyons.

review1.name: Ali K.
review1.content: A must-visit for climbers and adventure lovers.

review2.name: Sophie G.

name: Oracle Temple
description: Ancient temple dedicated to the god Amun, famous for its oracle that guided ancient rulers.

overview.description: The Oracle Temple, also known as the Temple of Amun, is one of Siwa‚Äôs most significant archaeological sites. It was visited by Alexander the Great to consult the oracle, making it a historical landmark of great importance.
overview.address: Aghurmi Village, Siwa Oasis, Matrouh, Egypt

detail.howToGet: Short tuk-tuk ride from Siwa center to Aghurmi village.
detail.tips: Wear comfortable shoes and bring water; the site has uneven terrain.

activity.name: Historical Tour
activity.description: Guided tour explaining the history of the temple and its significance in ancient times.

activity.name: Photography
activity.description: Capture stunning shots of the temple ruins and surrounding desert landscapes.

review1.name: Sara M.
review1.content: A fascinating place with deep history, worth visiting.

review2.name: John P.
review2.content: Amazing to walk in the footsteps of Alexander the Great.

name: Cleopatra‚Äôs Spring
description: A natural stone pool fed by a fresh water spring, believed to have been visited by Queen Cleopatra.

overview.description: Cleopatra‚Äôs Spring is a natural warm water spring in Siwa Oasis, surrounded by palm trees and cafes. Visitors can swim in the crystal-clear water, making it a refreshing stop on a tour of the oasis.

detail.howToGet: Walking distance or short tuk-tuk ride from Siwa town center.
detail.tips: Bring a swimsuit and towel, and enjoy a drink from nearby cafes.

activity.name: Swimming
activity.description: Enjoy a refreshing swim in the natural spring water.

activity.name: Relax at the Caf√©
activity.description: Sip fresh juice or tea at one of the shaded cafes surrounding the spring.

review1.name: Nour A.
review1.content: Beautiful spot, perfect for cooling off in the heat.

review2.name: Paul S.
review2.content: Great water and atmosphere, but can get crowded.

name: Dream Park
description: One of the largest amusement parks in Egypt. Offers thrill rides, family-friendly zones, and live shows.

overview.description: Dream Park is one of Egypt‚Äôs largest and most popular amusement parks, located on Wahat Road in the Dreamland Compound, 6th of October City, Giza. Established in 1999 and spanning over 150 acres, the park is divided into three main zones: Kids Zone, Family Zone, and Thrill Zone ‚Äî offering more than 30 attractions ranging from gentle rides to intense roller coasters. It features an inverted roller coaster with five loops, 5D and 7D simulators, bumper cars, a Ferris wheel, Go-Karts, and a famous Horror House.
overview.address: Wahat Road, Dreamland Compound, 6th of October City, Giza, Egypt

detail.howToGet: From Downtown Cairo: approx. 45‚Äì60 minutes
detail.tips: Go early to avoid queues

activity.title: Roller Coaster Ride
activity.description: Experience the inverted roller coaster with five loops for a heart-racing adventure.

activity.title: Horror House
activity.description: Walk through the famous horror-themed attraction with special effects.

activity.title: Go-Karts
activity.description: Race your friends on the dedicated go-kart track.

review1.content: Great for families. Kids loved it. Camel ride was fun but overpriced.

review2.content: Absolutely breathtaking! A must-see. Go early to avoid crowds

name: KidZania
description: An educational entertainment city where kids role-play real-life jobs in a safe and fun environment

overview.description: KidZania is a miniature city built for children, offering interactive role-play experiences where kids can try out real-world professions like doctors, firefighters, chefs, and more in a safe and fun environment.
overview.address: Cairo Festival City Mall, New Cairo, Egypt

detail.bestTimeToVisit: Weekdays for less crowd or weekends for full experience

activity.description: Kids prepare simple dishes and learn kitchen basics in a safe environment.

review1.content: A fantastic place for kids to learn and play! My daughter loved being a mini doctor.

review2.content: Great concept and very well organized. My son had an amazing time role-playing as a firefighter.

description: Indoor fun center with arcade games, bumper cars, and 7D cinema.

overview.address: Mall of Egypt, 6th of October City, Giza, Egypt
